com.ojcoleman.ahni.experiments.mr2d

Class EnvironmentDescription

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.ahni.experiments.mr2d.EnvironmentDescription
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Configurable

    public class EnvironmentDescription
extends java.lang.Object
implements Configurable
    Describes an environment for a Mobile Robot 2D simulation. An experiment run typically creates a singleton instance of this class (initialised via init(Properties)) which contains some pre-calculated values and then instances used for simulations are generated via the generateInstance(int, Random, MobileRobot2D) method.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EnvironmentDescription()
      This constructor is only for creating a singleton instance configured via init(Properties).

      • getReasonableRewardRange

        public Range getReasonableRewardRange()
        Returns:
        The minimum and maximum reward receivable from this environment, accounting for having to try each collectible object type to determine if it provides a positive reward.

      • getRewardRange

        public Range getRewardRange()
        Returns:
        The minimum and maximum possible reward receivable from this environment.
